More hours on console, just picked it back up again as it was incredibly cheap on sale along with the myriad of DLC, can honestly say the game is great. Whether you have a penchant for playing killer or survivor, there always an ample amount of things to do. If you care about variety, pick up some DLC and experiment with the large pool of killers and survivors they release with. Excellent atmosphere and you can never be sure that someone isn't stalking you, best experience is with Headphones to take advantage of the eerie sound design. I recommend highly.

Like any comment or review, this is harsh IMHO.
This game is unique in its own way. Like a two-faced Janus. Its developers are very good in terms of the visual component, the design of characters and maps, the atmosphere (especially with the last chapters), content, animations of actions and murders, the history of the world and its lore (here, in general, one of the best ideas of all time with Essence, rebirth after death , sacrifices, hopelessness and other goodies). And these same developers are bad in the technical part (bugs, lags, glitches, endless downloads and legendary hits that reach you through the window when you have already run 4 meters away, or axes that fly in the back when you have already turned the corner for a long time) and just awful in terms of game balance. And it's not even about the eternal dispute about who is too buffed: survivors or killers. Here the point is different: the developers came up with the mechanics of the game, and then they themselves somehow took and waved their hand at it, allowing groups of survs in their voice to participate in the rating on a par with random, without highlighting or informing the Killer that the team was against him ... And then they began to "balance" the broken game. As a result, it turned out to be nonsense, because the four randomness and the command in the voice are, as they say, two big differences, and the effect of different patches, changes and innovations on these two groups is fundamentally different. Having twisted something at the Survs, the developed ones greatly strengthen the teams, the killers begin to resent, they are sharply buffed or changed (or "nerfed" by the Survs), the life of ordinary random players becomes sad, they also begin to cry, and the process goes on in an endless circle, meaningless and merciless. The solution would seem to be elementary: separate these two groups. The killer simply needs to receive an alert if a team is against him, and be able to prepare (I'm already silent about some buffs to his perks). And after dividing, already balance your health, at least there will be a sense. But this is unlikely to ever be implemented ...
The "logic" of certain actions is delivered separately. For example, the developers introduced a punishment for disconnecting from a match (intentional or accidental), arguing that such actions affect the gaming experience of other players and prevent them from enjoying the game, reducing the chances of winning (or something like that). Seems alright. However, how about, for example, teammates who farm you black, taking you off the hook under the killer's nose without borrowed time, or, even worse, even specifically attracting the attention of the leaving maniac before farming your carcass (yes, immersive Claudette, this applies first of all to you)? What about killers who play you on the ground for the whole game until you just die according to the timer? What about the aforementioned groups in the voice that hang out at low ranks, tee-tag and mock new, inexperienced killers who are just learning how to play? I will not mention the camping of the hooks and further tunneling with the red mori (here you can still grit your teeth referring to the game mechanics or the killer's ritual or achievement). How about all this? Is this somehow supposed to amuse me and contribute to an enjoyable gaming experience? Does this prevent me from enjoying the game? Why is it not banned and punished? Do you really think that disconnect spoils the game much more than pharmaceuticalrazi (let's call a spade a spade), a killer with a red mori camping in the bushes, three minutes of lying on the ground with his face in the mud or a full command in his voice, which you will understand even then, code It will be late? Well, really?
In general, what I want to say is: the game would never have been bought if I knew all this in advance. Paradoxically, because I like it very much (the first sentences say why). That's it. If you haven't played yet, find something more adequate so that you don't have to smash your face with facepalms later, looking at the next "balancing" long-suffering broken game mechanics or at the next "endless" loading screen ...
